thread.title: Egyptian first lieutenant, 2 soldiers killed in explosion in northern Sinai region
thread.title_full: Egyptian first lieutenant, 2 soldiers killed in explosion in northern Sinai region | CP24.com

author: The Associated Press
title: Egyptian first lieutenant, 2 soldiers killed in explosion in northern Sinai region
text:
CAIRO -- An Egyptian first lieutenant and two soldiers were killed in an explosion which targeted a police armoured vehicle in the northern Sinai city of el-Arish Saturday, Egypt's Interior Ministry said.
Eight soldiers were injured in the explosion and have been transported to the hospital for treatment, the ministry said. Forces are combing the area of the explosion, according to the ministry.
The incident follows a Friday roadside bomb which killed a police officer, also in el-Arish.
The Egyptian government has been battling a long-running insurgency in northern Sinai, which escalated after the military ousted Islamist President Mohammed Morsi in July 2013 amid massive protests against his rule and cracked down on Islamic groups.
The Islamic State affiliate in Egypt has claimed responsibility for multiple attacks in northern Sinai.
While the violence has largely been confined to Sinai, bombs have also hit other parts of the country, including Cairo.
